title: The math behind winning.
body:
There are 5 people on your team, 4 of which are not you, that leaves 80% (5 x 20% = 100%) of the responsibility to win the game out of your hands.

If I put in at least 75% of my 20% (I'm not perfect) that makes 15% spoken for.

If one of my teammates puts in only 50%, that adds 10%.

Let's assume two other teammates put in 15% for a total of 30%.

That leaves us at 55% of our responsibility as a team covered with one teammate left, who we can assume will put in 15% (we hope). Giving us a 70% chance to win.

You can see how drastically low your chance of winning becomes the less your teammates contribute even if you are giving your best.
